class_notes: CONTENT: The course is an introduction to the people, history, culture, society, and politics of Latin America. The focus of the course is on contemporary issues, including those that affect U.S. - Latin America relations. The course follows a basic lecture format but discussion is encouraged. Lectures are usually accompanied by visual materials derived from video documentaries or websites.
course_description: An interdisciplinary introduction to Latin America and the Caribbean and to the LACS Program at Emory. The course provides historical background and familiarizes students with contemporary political, social, economic, and cultural issues.
sections: Class Nbr: 3449, Section #: 1, Type: LEC, Campus: ATL, Meets: TTh 2:30-3:45p, Instructor: R. Goddard, Status: Open
